title: Strictly Come Dancing's Rylan addresses 'bust-up' with Zoe Ball
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing’s It Takes Two presenter Rylan Clark-Neal has addressed reports that he had a behind-the-scenes fallout with co-host Zoe Ball.

The TV personality, who was welcomed onto the BBC sister show alongside Zoe this year, joined Simon Rimmer and Tim Lovejoy on Sunday Brunch to discuss all the action.

‘The fans of Strictly are on it,’ Rylan said. ‘There was a story this morning saying me and Zoe had a massive bust-up on Friday in rehearsals.

‘Yeah a big old bust-up,’ he added sarcastically before explaining what really went down.

Rubbishing the claims, Rylan revealed: ‘I was late, I missed rehearsals. I was flying back from my DJ gig. It was news to me.’

Rylan Clark-Neal rubbished the feud (Picture: Channel 4)

Rylan and Zoe present It Takes Two together (Picture: BBC)

Talking about joining It Takes Two, he said: ‘For me as well with Big Brother not being there now, to do a spin-off show again and to do it with Strictly, the biggest show on TV, it was an absolute honour to be asked to join that family.’

Strictly entered its fourth week this weekend and last night’s episode was filled to the brim as the celebrities returned to the ballroom.

Katya Jones plunged to the floor in tears after dancing with Mike Bushell to Come On Eileen, citing a particularly difficult week of rehearsals.

Meanwhile, Craig Revel Hoorwood branded Kelvin Fletcher ‘filth’ as he critiqued the Emmerdale star’s rumba.

Speaking after his dance, Craig said: ‘Well you’re obviously in touch with yourself darling. We can certainly see that.

‘It was full of machismo which I loved. It oozed masculinity. It was filth.’

As the panelists cackled, Motsi Mabuse joked: ‘I don’t know, you know. I’m just like, hold on Kelvin that’s my sister, stop it!’
